channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-356] [HbaseShell] Addition of HQL (Hbase Query Language) support in Hbase Shell
item.description:
We have defined the HQL (Hbase Query Language), which is a "more" SQL-like query language for Hbase, for use in Hbase Shell. HQL is not intended to fully support the SQL syntax and semantics. HQL, instead, is developed to make it easy to manipulate tables in Hbase through the Hbase Shell command line, without using programming APIs.

You can find more information about HQL in http://wiki.apache.org/lucene-hadoop/Hbase/HbaseShell/HQL.
item.summary: [HbaseShell] Addition of HQL (Hbase Query Language) support in Hbase Shell

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Thanks, Inchul

I edited the insert syntax.


Hbase > INSERT INTO movieLog_table 

      -> ( year:, length:, inColor:, studioName:, vote:user_1, producer: ) 

      -> VALUES ('1991', '124', 'true', 'Disney', '2', 'Blair Peters') 

      -> WHERE row='Mighty Ducks';

apply changes for drop table syntax

DROP TABLE table_name [, table_name] ...

The delete() method in HTable seems not working.
After implementing the DELETE syntax, I've tested if it works. However,
the deleted cells still show up in the result of SELECT.

Need further investigation.

HBase > select movie;

+------+----------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

| No.  | Row                  | Column               | Cell                 | 

+------+----------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

| 1    | Star Wars            | length:              | 124                  |

+------+----------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

| 2    | Star Wars            | year:                | 1977                 |

+------+----------------------+----------------------+----------------------+



Successfully print out the selected data.(30.22 sec)



HBase > delete length: from movie where row='Star Wars';

07/08/16 22:26:54 INFO shell.DeleteCommand: Deleting length:...

Column(s) deleted successfully.(0.01 sec)



HBase > select movie;

+------+----------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

| No.  | Row                  | Column               | Cell                 | 

+------+----------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

| 1    | Star Wars            | length:              | 124                  |

+------+----------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

| 2    | Star Wars            | year:                | 1977                 |

+------+----------------------+----------------------+----------------------+



Successfully print out the selected data.(0.05 sec)

HBase >

The current version of delete() method in trunk is working well.
Must've been my mistake. I'll check it out.

Apply changes for the syntax of DELETE, ENABLE and DISABLE statements.

DELETE column_name, [, column_name] ...

  FROM table_name

  WHERE row = 'row-key'



ENABLE table_name



DISABLE table_name

Inchul,
If you can think of any even better way to output results, let me know on this issue.
May I suggest u to fix output class on this issue?
May I proceed with a new issue?
Sure, go ahead.

Version that applies against TRUNK (HBaseShell.jj changed over the weekend in a path that broke v3 of this patch).

Otherwise Inchul, the patch looks good but incomplete. For example, you have not changed the help in line with new additions/changes. Is your tactic adding a patch per piece of implementation? (If so, please add a description of what each patch adds beyond the previous – helps when reading the patch).

Good stuff.

Yes, Edward and I am making changes together. Each takes
different part of the language.

We'll let others know what changes are made for every new patch.

Have you any good ideas for writing the results of a select statement into a text file on the hadoop dfs?
(I think just tab delimited file, now)

You may see the entry about CSV in Wikipedia.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comma-separated_values

You may find useful links in there.

You can also consult the source code of MySQL,
especially the part where the select, or load syntaxes
are implemented.

Well, I think it would be better to exporting results to Hadoop File format or <K,V> map structure rather than CSV.

More thinking.......

The select syntax looks great. Can I quote the column names in the select statement as in:


select "inColor:", "length:" from "movieLog_table";

... in case column name qualifiers contain spaces?

Regards output, I like the idea of leveraging hadoop filesystem for target so dependent on how the shell is configured, the output lands on local filesystem or up in hdfs (or in amz) dependent on shell client config (Or, if folks include an URL scheme, that should work too as in '...into hdfs://namenode:8888/hbase/output/dump.txt)

Regards output format, I like the noises about modeling output on how mysql does it. In order of importance, I can imagine folks wanting output unadorned (e.g. 'select page:content from repository where row="http://apache.com/index.html"' to get JUST the apache home page content), ascii tables, mapfiles keyed by row with columns for values, csv, xml, html, etc. If you can figure a means of allowing output formatter plugins (or using an existing formatting system if such a thing exists) whether invocation of velocity templates, etc., that'd be sweet.

A bunch of interesting ideas, Stack.

We should definitely create an issue for this: input and output methods
in HQL and Hbase Shell.
Here's a trivial clean-up patch for HQL.

Progress report:

Things already done:

  • INSERT
  • DELETE, except DELETE * FROM
  • DROP
  • ENABLE, DISABLE
  • SELECT

Things to to:

  • CREATE
  • ALTER
  • Various formatting methods in SELECT

1. CREATE TABLE implemented.

HBase > create table webtable (

    --> contents in_memory max_versions=10 compression=block,

    --> anchor max_length=256 bloomfilter=counting                                  

    --> vector_size=1000000 num_hash=4);

Please wait. Creating table...

Table created successfully.

2. Help contents changed to reflect the changed syntax.

HBase > help create;

CREATE    Create tables



Syntax:

CREATE TABLE table_name

        column_family_spec [, column_family_spec] ...



column_family_spec:

        column_family_name

        [MAX_VERSIONS=n]

        [MAX_LENGTH=n]

        [COMPRESSION=NONE|RECORD|BLOCK]

        [IN_MEMORY]

        [BLOOMFILTER=NONE|BLOOM|COUNTING|RETOUCHED VECTOR_SIZE=n NUM_HASH=n]



HBase >

3. Progress report

Things done:

  • INSERT
  • DELETE, except DELETE * FROM
  • DROP
  • ENABLE, DISABLE
  • SELECT
  • CREATE

Things to to:

  • ALTER
  • DESCRIBE

I suspect some collision between <STRING> and <ID>.


HBase > fs -ls;

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "-ls" at line 1, column 5.

1. ALTER TABLE add implemented, and verified that it is working.

HBase > alter table webtable add length in_memory;

Disabling webtable... Please wait.

07/08/29 19:30:47 INFO hbase.HBaseAdmin: Disabled table webtable

Please wait. Adding length to webtable...

Enabling webtable... Please wait.

07/08/29 19:30:47 INFO hbase.HBaseAdmin: Enabled table webtable

Table altered successfully.

HBase > desc webtable;

+------+----------------------+

| No.  | ColumnFamily Name    |

+------+----------------------+

| 1    | anchor               |

+------+----------------------+

| 2    | contents             |

+------+----------------------+

| 3    | length               |

+------+----------------------+



3 columnfamilie(s) found.(0.07 sec)

2. ALTER TABLE DROP seems not working.
I've tested it several times and verified that HbaseAdmin.deleteColumn()
actually is being called, but with no effect to the table.

Could somebody please test it in your environment for me?

HBase > alter table webtable drop contents;

Disabling webtable... Please wait.

07/08/29 19:42:45 INFO hbase.HBaseAdmin: Disabled table webtable

Dropping contents from webtable... Please wait.

Enabling webtable... Please wait.

07/08/29 19:42:45 INFO hbase.HBaseAdmin: Enabled table webtable

Table altered successfully.

HBase > desc webtable;                     

+------+----------------------+

| No.  | ColumnFamily Name    |

+------+----------------------+

| 1    | anchor               |

+------+----------------------+

| 2    | contents             |

+------+----------------------+

| 3    | length               |

+------+----------------------+



3 columnfamilie(s) found.(0.02 sec)

3. Progress report:

Things to do:

  • Fix a bug in ALTER TABLE DROP.
  • ALTER TABLE CHANGE
  • DELETE * FROM
  • DESCRIBE

[javac] C:\cygwin\home\Administrator\workspace\hadoop\src\contrib\hbase\src\

java\org\apache\hadoop\hbase\shell\SchemaModificationCommand.java:95: cannot fin

d symbol

I think you used a old-BloomFilterDescriptor class for a SchemaModificationCommand.
Before implementing, you first need to check out the project from the repository.

Check, Please!

Thank you for your help, Edward.
I am working on it.

I made some changes for the code to use the updated API.

But, ALTER TABLE DROP still isn't working.

Edward, would you please check it again with this patch applied?

Thank you, Inchul. it works nicely.

let's implement things by create each sub-task for more convenient collaboration.
So, I would like to submit v09.patch.

Yes, it's been long enough. I'll submit the latest patch,
and let's tackle down each of the problems in a series of
sub-tasks or issues.

We would like to submit the latest patch.

In the latest patch:

1. Several HQL statements implemented

  • INSERT
  • DELETE
  • DROP
  • ENABLE, DISABLE
  • SELECT
  • CREATE
  • ALTER ADD

2. Not yet been tackled

There are several statements that are not yet implemented due to
various problems. Each of these problems may become an issue
by itself.

  • DELETE * FROM
    Due to the inconvenience in the API. There's no convenient way to delete
    all values in a column family. For example, the method HTable.delete()
    only allows fully-qualified names, like HTable.delete("anchor").
  • SELECT INTO
    The issue HADOOP-1789 is
    tackling this issue. We'll come back to SELECT INTO after that issue has
    been completed.
  • ALTER DROP
    We guess that there a problem in the HBaseAdmin.deleteColumn() method.
    A specified column is not deleted even if the method is certainly called.
    However, not yet been verified thoroughly.
  • ALTER CHANGE
    We think that there is no way to change a column family name
    without deleting all the values in the column family. The only way
    to change a column family is, first delete the column family and then
    add a new column family. We need a way to only change
    a column family name and its options without deleting the values
    inside.

It's been long enough, and much code has been accumulated
through this issue, so let us submit this patch. We'll tackle down each of the
remaining problems through later issues.

If there is any reason to delay submitting this patch, let us know, and
we'll do our best to make things done as soon as possible.

Here's some comments on the patch lads:

This is a large amount of new functionality but it is without unit tests. Regression in something as complicated as a shell is a real danger. Do you have any objection to adding at least a basic test that does a setup of a minihbasecluster adding a table using your create command (with assertion that add was successful, and that all options specified were enabled, perhaps using your describe command), and then disable, enable, input, select, and drop asserting each of the steps has happened as you go? (I can help out if you'd like).

The 'fs -ls' issue remains. Do you want to fix that before committing or do you want to make a new issue to fix this? (I tried setting the command back to 'dfs' from 'fs' but it is still broken. Did I commit a broken feature?)

The describe command does not list out the properties that are advertised as settable in the create command. Is this intentional? (this is a minor item I'd say)

I tried to create a table:


HBase > create testing ma_versions=3 compression=none in_memory bloomfilter=none;

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "testing" at line 1, column 9.

HBase > create table testing ma_versions=3 compression=none in_memory bloomfilter=none;

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "ma_versions" at line 1, column 23.

HBase > create table testing max_versions=3 compression=none in_memory bloomfilter=none;

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "max_versions" at line 1, column 23.

HBase > create table testing family max_versions=3 compression=none in_memory bloomfilter=none;

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "family" at line 1, column 23.

HBase > create table testing 'family' max_versions=3 compression=none in_memory bloomfilter=none;

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "\'family\'" at line 1, column 23.

HBase > create table testing 'family:' max_versions=3 compression=none in_memory bloomfilter=none;

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "\'family:\'" at line 1, column 23.

HBase > create table testing family: max_versions=3 compression=none in_memory bloomfilter=none; 

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "family:" at line 1, column 23.

HBase > create table 'testing' 'family:' max_versions=3 compression=none in_memory bloomfilter=none;

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "\'testing\'" at line 1, column 15.

HBase > create table "testing" "family:" max_versions=3 compression=none in_memory bloomfilter=none;

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "\"testing\"" at line 1, column 15.

HBase > create table testing family: max_versions=3 compression=none in_memory bloomfilter=none;   

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "family:" at line 1, column 23.

HBase > create table testing test;

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "test" at line 1, column 23.

I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong in the above.

It does not look as though I can put quotes around family names. I would think I'd need to if a column qualifier had a space. For example:


HBase > select repo:url;

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered ";" at line 1, column 17.

HBase > select 'repo:url' from hbaserepository;

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "\'repo:url\'" at line 1, column 9.

HBase > select "repo:url" from hbaserepository;

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "\"repo:url\"" at line 1, column 9.

HBase > select repo:url from hbaserepository;

(The last one above worked).

Trying to select a column from a specified row, the below happens:


HBase > select repo:url from hbaserepository where row=PPFW-00SOmohQD4kQcyk==;

Syntax error: Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "PPFW-00SOmohQD4kQcyk" at line 1, column 49.

HBase > select repo:url from hbaserepository where row="PPFW-00SOmohQD4kQcyk==";

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException

        at org.apache.hadoop.io.Text.encode(Text.java:375)

        at org.apache.hadoop.io.Text.set(Text.java:165)

        at org.apache.hadoop.io.Text.<init>(Text.java:71)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shell.SelectCommand.setRowKey(SelectCommand.java:215)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shell.generated.Parser.selectCommand(Parser.java:593)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shell.generated.Parser.cmdStatement(Parser.java:137)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shell.generated.Parser.terminatedCommand(Parser.java:85)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.Shell.main(Shell.java:60)

Digging further, it looks like I need to quote using single-quotes only – is that right? If so, we should put this fact into the help and perhaps into the shell preamble.

Regards the patch, it looks good. I would suggest that error output be put on System.err rather than on System.out (In general you probably want to keep the errors and informational output on one stream and your generated output on the other). You have an assert in DeleteCommand. Why not make this throw an actual exception if passed value is null?

+1

http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12364822/hql_v09.patch applied and successfully tested against trunk revision r571211.

Test results: http://lucene.zones.apache.org:8080/hudson/job/Hadoop-Patch/656/testReport/
Console output: http://lucene.zones.apache.org:8080/hudson/job/Hadoop-Patch/656/console

I edited the literal tokens in HBaseShell.jj and the Select Command for UTF-8 output.

Patch's are somewhat complicated.
So, I would like to implement other things by creating each sub-task for more convenient collaboration.

Hey Edward: Does the patch fix/address any of the issues I raise above? If so, which? And I'm not sure I understand your comment correctly: Are you suggesting that issues w/ the patch be addressed as sub-issues? Or does 'other things' mean something else?
to reflect the suggestions to the previously submitted patch.

I mean just about series or parallel collaborative works.

with more than two people working on one same issue,
we can't find out who's working on which part nor who's more available to work.

but, ...
I'll submit just after reported bug fixes.

CREATE TABLE movieLog_table (year, length, inColor, studioName, vote, producer);

CREATE TABLE webtable (contents in_memory max_versions=10 compression=block, anchor max_length=256 bloomfilter=counting_bloomfilter vector_size=1000000 num_hash=4);





INSERT INTO movieLog_table (year:, length:, inColor:, studioName:, vote:udanax, producer:) VALUES ('1977', '124', 'true', 'Fox', '5', 'George Lucas') WHERE row='Star Wars';





INSERT INTO movieLog_table (year:, length:, inColor:, studioName:, vote:xanadu, producer:) VALUES ('1991', '124', 'true', 'Disney', '2', 'Blair Peters') WHERE row='Mighty Ducks';





INSERT INTO movieLog_table (year:, length:, inColor:, studioName:, "vote:user 1", producer:) VALUES ('1992', '95', 'true', 'Paramount', '3', 'Penelope Spheeris') WHERE row='Wayne`s World';





Hbase > SELECT * FROM movieLog_table;

Hbase > SELECT "vote:user 1" FROM movieLog_table;

+------+----------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

| No.  | Row                  | Column               | Cell                 |

+------+----------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

| 1    | Wayne`s World        | vote:user 1          | 3                    |

+------+----------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
Please commit this patch.

Hey Edward: A few things before committing the patch:

You made the patch on a machine that has different line-ending settings from that of the source you were making the patch against. To the patch program, it looks as though every line has changed though most of the time it is only the line-endings that differ. This makes it hard distingushing legitimate changes.

I fixed up the patch and regenerated a new v13 that has changes only including a few of my own:

+ DESC and DESCRIBE were present in the help listings (I removed DESC).
+ I removed the clear of the screen on shell launch. I hope you do not mind. I've found the automatic clearing of screen a little annoying. Usually I need something from the screen such as a command to copy.
+ I fixed the help for create tables to add parens around column families (Looks like they are needed going by the below).


Hbase > help create;

CREATE    Create tables



Syntax:

CREATE TABLE table_name

        column_family_spec [, column_family_spec] ...



column_family_spec:

        column_family_name

        [MAX_VERSIONS=n]

        [MAX_LENGTH=n]

        [COMPRESSION=NONE|RECORD|BLOCK]

        [IN_MEMORY]

        [BLOOMFILTER=NONE|BLOOM|COUNTING|RETOUCHED VECTOR_SIZE=n NUM_HASH=n]

    

Hbase > create table x y;

Syntax error : Type 'help;' for usage.

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shell.generated.ParseException: Encountered "y" at line 1, column 17.

Was expecting:

    "(" ...

Other issues:

+ Naming column families, it looks like the ':' terminating colon is optional. Is this intentional? Would be less confusing if it just required them or not especially as later when I try to insert values, its required:


Hbase > insert into x (y) values ('xxx') where row='z';

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.InvalidColumnNameException: y is missing the colon family/qualifier separator

+ The console table formatting seems broken (Try doing a select on the 'ROOT' table.
+ Single vs. double quotes is inconsistent:


Hbase > insert into x (y) values ('xxx') where row="z";

Syntax error : Type 'help;' for usage.

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shell.generated.ParseException: Encountered "\"z\"" at line 1, column 45.

Was expecting:

    <STRING_LITERAL> ...

Above you have example of column names having double quotes but when I try to use them on a row name I get the above complaint.

Here is another example where I try to double quote a column name making an insert:


Hbase > insert into x ("y:y") values ('xxx') where row="z";

Syntax error : Type 'help;' for usage.

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shell.generated.ParseException: Encountered "\"z\"" at line 1, column 49.

Was expecting:

    <STRING_LITERAL> ...

I'd suggest that double-quotes are either allowed everywhere or they are allowed nowhere.

Why is it complaining about the following:


Hbase > insert into x ('y:y') values ('xxx') where row='z';

Syntax error : Type 'help;' for usage.

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shell.generated.ParseException: Encountered "\'y:y\'" at line 1, column 17.

Was expecting one of:

    "*" ...

    <ID> ...

    <QUOTED_ID> ...

'y:' is a column family for table 'x' (It looks like INSERT does not want quotes around the column which makes it so if column name has spaces, I cannot insert values).
Version 13. Fixes to help contents removing duplicate listing, adding ';' after all usage outputs, and removing the initial clear console.

The string must be enclosed in single quotation marks, as in '...'.
The quoted identifier for table name and column name must be enclosed in double quotation marks, as in "...".

ex) SELECT * FROM "Blanks in table name" where row = 'Row Key String';


Hbase > select 'inColor:true' from movieLog_table;

The quoted identifier for table name and column name must

be enclosed in double quotation marks, as in "...".



Hbase > select * from movieLog_table where row = "Star Wars";

The string must be enclosed in single quotation marks, as in '...'.



Hbase > select "vote:user 1" from movieLog_table;

+------+----------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

| No.  | Row                  | Column               | Cell                 |

+------+----------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

| 1    | Wayne`s World        | vote:user 1          | 3                    |

+------+----------------------+----------------------+----------------------+



Successfully print out the selected data.(0.04 sec)

Hbase >

@see : http://www.hadoop.co.kr/wiki/moin.cgi/Hbase/HbaseShell

Edward: Don't you think two quoting mechanisms confusing?

Also, thinking on it on my way home, my adding in parens around column names in the help contents was retrograde; you and Inchul have done a bunch of work to move hql closer to sql. My adding parens revived the old hbase shell syntax so rather its the parser that needs fixing, not the help.

It looks like patch version 14 has the same issue as v12 in that the bulk of it is just reporting difference in line endings (check it out yourself).

Stack, it was my mistake that the parens were omitted in the help for CREATE.

We designed CREATE with parens in it, and implemented CREATE with that in mind,
but I mistakenly missed to add the parens to the help for CREATE.

So, let's not remove them, but just put those parens in there.

Stack : I want simple syntax, too.
but, i don't want to use either single and double quotes for string literals and identifier delimiters.
So, i made a distinction between single and double quotes.

Here we can see one of the semantic differences between single and double quotes.


SELECT "c1:blanks in column key_1" FROM table_name WHERE row = 'c1:blanks in column key_1';

+1

http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12365129/hql_v14.patch applied and successfully tested against trunk revision r572826.

Test results: http://lucene.zones.apache.org:8080/hudson/job/Hadoop-Patch/687/testReport/
Console output: http://lucene.zones.apache.org:8080/hudson/job/Hadoop-Patch/687/console

Moving issue status back to 'resume progress' (Otherwise, it would seem to trigger a hudson build on each new patch upload).

Edward: Help me out. I'm having difficulty distinguishing where 'string literals' and 'identifiers' should be used. Your example above confuses me. Row name is a 'string literal' but i'd think that a users would be inclined to group row name with column and table names and therefore classify row name an 'identifier' and therefore worthy of double-quotes.

Inchul: I took a look at other sql create syntax and indeed column specification are wrapped in parens.
Tell me what you want.

IMO, it will be less confusing to users if they can use either single or double quotes. It would be their choice (Later, double-quotes would allow interpolations. Single-quotes would not). Otherwise, HQL should use single quotes or double quotes exclusively. What do you think Edward?

Thank you, Stack.

and now ....
I think delimident environment variable as described below.

  <property>

 	<name>hbaseshell.jline.bell.enabled</name>

  	<value>true</value>

  	<description>

  		if true, enable audible keyboard bells if an alert is required.

  	</description>

  </property>  

  

  <property>

  	<name>hbaseshell.delimident.environment</name>

  	<value>false</value>

  	<description>

  		The delimident environment variable specifies that ......
inchul and me jus decided to use either single and double quotes for strings.
Good stuff... Does v15 of the patch include this change? (FYI: This patch again is filled mostly with just differences in line-endings).
line-endings?

Edward: Take a look at the patch. See how it first removes all the lines for a bunch of classes followed immediately by an adding back of lines? For example, see the first class Shell.java in v15. See how patches I put up are nearly half the size (though they include all you've changed?). How are you generating the patches?
Fixed it.
Thanks Edward. What else does v16 have? Does it have the single or double quotes around Strings? Does it fix other issues raised in the comment above on 04/Sep/07 11:35 AM?

• fixed "delete * from"

Hbase > delete * from movieLog_table where row='Wayne`s World';

Column(s) deleted successfully.(0.02 sec)

Hbase >
but, I think something(semantically) is wrong with delete command syntax.

delete * from table_name where row='row_key' ....

I think we need to have a delete marking feature (API) that can take out All the data in a row.

attached v19.patch.
I just used getRow() method for "delete * from ... "


columnList = hTable.getRow(new Text(this.rowKey)).keySet().toArray(new Text[] {});



for (Text column : columnList) {

  hTable.delete(lockID, new Text(column));

}

If it's okay with you, i would like to submit this patch.
and, If you are not sure about committing this patch, let me know.

Edward: How are you making these patches? They don't apply for me. Do they for you? Looking at the patch I cannot see anything obviously wrong. Here is the complaint:


durruti:~/Documents/checkouts/hadoop-trunk stack$ patch -p0 < ~/Desktop/hql_v19.patch

(Stripping trailing CRs from patch.)

patching file src/contrib/hbase/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/Shell.java

patching file src/contrib/hbase/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/shell/DeleteCommand.java

Hunk #1 FAILED at 20.

1 out of 1 hunk FAILED -- saving rejects to file src/contrib/hbase/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/shell/DeleteCommand.java.rej

(Stripping trailing CRs from patch.)

patching file src/contrib/hbase/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/shell/CreateCommand.java

patching file src/contrib/hbase/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/shell/HelpManager.java

Hunk #1 succeeded at 40 with fuzz 2 (offset -1 lines).

missing header for unified diff at line 258 of patch

can't find file to patch at input line 258

Perhaps you used the wrong -p or --strip option?

The text leading up to this was:

--------------------------

|         + "licensed to Apache Software Foundation.\n"

--------------------------

File to patch:

... which is a strange complaint when I stare at the supposed problematic line. It seems fine to me.

I was in the middle of hand-fixing v18. Let me start now on v19 and try and give you some feedback.

Looking more at your patch, the offsets are wrong. For example, look at this snippet from the HelpManager portion of the patch:


@@ -41,7 +41,6 @@

    

   

   /** Print out the program version. */

   public void printVersion() {

-    ClearCommand.clear();

     System.out.println(APP_NAME + ", " + APP_VERSION + " version.\n"

It says that 7 lines starting at 41 are to be replaced with 6 lines (w/ ClearCommand removed) but there are 8 lines provided. If I manually change line numbers I can get it apply. How are you generating the patches Edward?

Thank you for your review, Stack.

Patches was edited by manually altering the code. (but, I had no problem with these.)
I'll clean this up.
Here's a clean-up patch.

Edward: v20 worked smoothly for me whatever you did and regards your remark that there is no means of deleting all in a row on 10/Sep/07 02:03 AM, yes, that is true. HADOOP-1550 will fix this.

Edward/Inchul: In patch v20, you still have to specify single-quotes for rows and values when doing an insert. See output below. This looks to me like the only thing in the way of this patch getting committed (long ago its features exceeded the current shell facility. The 'alter table' feature particularly is very nice). Would this be easy to fix?


Hbase > insert into "abc" ("abc:") values ('abcd') where row='abc';

1 row inserted successfully.(0.00 sec)

Hbase > insert into "abc" ("abc:") values ('abcd') where row="abc";

Syntax error : Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "\"abc\"" at line 1, column 55.

Hbase > insert into "abc" ("abc:") values ("abcd") where row='abc';

Mismatch between values list and columnfamilies list

ConsoleTable is also broken if column names or row names are longer than the 20 characters but I do not see this as a blocker (and I think Izaak is going to make a patch for ConsoleTable tomorrow that should help in this regard).

Otherwise, your patch looks good.

This v21 does a little cleanup and adds unit tests for create, describe, drop, insert, etc. The create, etc., test is commented out currently. The test testInsertSelectDelete currently fails because it tries to wrap row name in an insert in double quotes. It'll start to pass when you fix the above issue. Feel free to add others (smile).

Thanks lads.

• edited the help string for "drop" command. ( DROP TABLE table_name[, table_name]...; )

Hbase > help drop;

Syntax:

DROP table_name [, table_name] ...;



Hbase > drop movieLog_table;

Syntax error : Type 'help' for usage: Encountered "movieLog_table" at line 1, column 7.

>>> ConsoleTable is also broken if column names or row names are longer than the 20 characters but I do not see this as a blocker (and I think Izaak is going to make a patch for ConsoleTable tomorrow that should help in this regard).

>>> This v21 does a little cleanup and adds unit tests for create, describe, drop, insert, etc. The create, etc., test is commented out currently. The test testInsertSelectDelete currently fails because it tries to wrap row name in an insert in double quotes. It'll start to pass when you fix the above issue. Feel free to add others (smile).

Thank you, Stack.

I appreciate your contribution and your code has been very helpful

v25 adds:

+ Unit tests for select and delete (w/ quotes around rows and column family tests)
+ Fixed missing imports on testhbaseshell
+ Fixed some help descriptions
+ added back some of my little formatting changes that were lost.
+ Fixed delete so that the row doesn't have to be a 'STRINGLITERAL' only.
Trying against hudson.

I forgot to add that v25 also makes the describe more interesting printing out all column family properties, not just column family name.
